intro: Argyrolobium album, commonly known as the white flax or silver flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Argyrolobium album is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding vegetation.
